title: Multiplayer Character Roles
longDescription:
The next instalment in our line of code plugins, the Character Role System was made for designers, by designers and makes a crucial part of many multiplayer games very easy. You can create whatever Roles you want your players to experience, just by defining their Win and Lose conditions.


You have Editor and Runtime control over the settings for each Role, and the system will take care of the rest. Automatic registration and assignment is built in, as well as checking if any players have won/lost this plugin is incredibly powerful for both designers and programmers. We have a plugin roadmap, and are going to be making a LTS version of this plugin for our initial engine version, 5.2, so you don't have to worry about updating your project version to keep up.
technicalDetails:
Features:

  • Can define Roles using the Character Role Component:
  • Define Win and Lose Conditions
  • Role Names
  • Players and Designers can finetune the settings on the Character Role Manager Component in Editor or Runtime:
  • AssignedRoleCount -> How many of this Role has currently been Assigned (Read Only)
  • RoleCount -> How many of this Role can be Assigned
  • RoleProbability -> How likely is this role to be Assigned (0-1)
  • bCanBeOverwritten -> If the Role can be overwritten by another Role
  • bCanBeMissed -> If the Role can be missed, or if it has to be assigned
  • Character Register Components automatically create and add the right Character Role Component to their Owners at runtime, no blueprint required.


More info here: Documentation


Code Modules:


  • CharacterRolesPlugin: Runtime
  • MultiplayerCharacterRoles: Runtime


Number of Blueprints: 4

Number of C++ Classes: 4

Network Replicated: (Yes)

Supported Development Platforms: Win64

Supported Target Build Platforms: Game, Server

Documentation: https://spyderweb-character-roles-docs.netlify.app/
